eg_particle_interactions.config.title: Particle Interactions Config
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Spawn when block placed
Should %s particles spawn when a block is placed?
Max particles when block placed
The maximum amount of particles that can spawn along each edge of the block when it is placed
Max particles when block placed
The maximum amount of particles that can spawn when the block is placed
Spawn when block broken
Should %s particles spawn when a block is broken?
Max particles when block broken
The maximum amount of particles that can spawn along each axis of the block when it is broken
Max particles when block broken
The maximum amount of particles that can spawn when the block is broken
Spawn when item used
Should %s particles spawn when the item is used?
Amount of particles when item used
The amount of %s particles that spawn when the item is used
Particle Intensity
The speed that the %s particles have when spawned
Render distance (blocks)
The maximum distance that %s particles will be visible from, in blocks
Amount of particles on interaction
The amount of %s particles to spawn for each interaction
Override enabled
Should the %s Particle Override be enabled
Particle enabled
Should %s particles be spawned
Particle spawn chance
The chance for %s particles to be spawned each tick
Amount of particles when item crafted
The amount of %s particles that should be spawned when an item is crafted
Spawn particles at max speed?
Should %s particles be spawned when a minecart is moving close to max speed?
Particle spawn chance per wheel
The chance for %s particles to be spawned each tick for each minecart wheel. This is scaled based on the minecart speed
Spawn only with passenger?
Should %s particles only be spawned if there is a passenger riding the minecart? A passenger counts as any entity riding the minecart or a block inside the minecart, e.g: a chest for chest minecarts
Ambient particle spawn chance
The chance for %s particles to be spawned from the entity each tick
Spawn when entity is damaged?
Should %s particles be spawned when the entity is damaged?
Amount of particles on damage
How many %s particles should spawn when the entity is damaged
General config options for the mod
General config options for the mod
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Pixel consistent block / item particles

Makes the particles that appear when mining blocks, placing blocks, or eating food be pixel consistent.

Try disabling this if you are having visual issues with other mods or resourcepacks
Particle z-fighting fix

Fixes particles z-fighting (glitching) with each-other when looking downwards, MC-91873 on the bug tracker. This fix isn't perfect but it works for most cases.

This fix works by moving each particle upwards by a small amount when it lands on a block.

Disable this if particles from other mods are acting weirdly or not moving correctly. You may also want to disable this if you have another mod that also fixes this issue
Config options that may have an impact on performance
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Advanced particle physics

Controls whether some particles have advanced physics, such as sparks bouncing.

Disabling this may slightly improve performance
CAUTION: Don't change these options unless you have been told to or know what you are doing.
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Toggle interaction debug logs

Logs information to the log when you interact with certain things.

This will be disabled the next time you open the game
Show particle emitter bounds

Visualises particle emitter bounding boxes with a particle in the bottom north-west corner and top south-east corner.

This will be disabled the next time you open the game
eg_particle_interactions.config.blocks.d: Configure particle overrides for blocks. These overrides replace the vanilla block particles
eg_particle_interactions.config.blocks.i: The following options in this tab are applied from top to bottom. This means if a block is specified in two separate particle overrides, it will only emit first override that is enabled
eg_particle_interactions.config.blocks.g: Blocks that should spawn %s particles interacted with
eg_particle_interactions.config.blocks.v:
When should %s particles be emitted?

The %s particles will be applied to all blocks that aren't specified in any other override. If this override is disabled, the %s particles will not spawn.
This only applies when placing, breaking, or mining blocks!
eg_particle_interactions.config.blocks.t:
When should %s particles be emitted?

These particles are tinted with the biome colour or the average texture colour if the block doesn't have a biome tint
Blocks that should spawn %s particles interacted with

When should %s particles be emitted?

These particles are tinted with the biome colour or a random colour from the texture if the block doesn't have a biome tint
Blocks that should spawn %s particles interacted with
eg_particle_interactions.config.block_am: Configure how particles are emitted from blocks in the world or when interacting with blocks
Configure how particles are emitted from blocks in the world or when interacting with blocks
Control how many %s particles should be spawned and when
Configure if %s particles should be spawned and the chance for them to spawn each tick
Configure if %s particles should be spawned and the chance for them to spawn each tick
Configure if %s particles should be spawned when crafting an item in an anvil.
Configure if %s particles should be spawned when grinding an item in a grindstone
Configure if particles should be spawned when a block is falling and when it lands
Configure if redstone dust particles should be spawned when some redstone components are interacted with. This applies to redstone dust, repeaters, and comparators
eg_particle_interactions.config.entity.d: Configure how particles are emitted from entities in the world
eg_particle_interactions.config.entity.i: Configure how particles are emitted from entities in the world
eg_particle_interactions.config.entity.m: Configure if %s particles should be spawned and the chance for them to spawn each tick
eg_particle_interactions.config.entity.b: Configure if %s particles should be spawned randomly, if the entity is hurt, and the chance for them to spawn each tick
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.de: Configure how particles are emitted when using or interacting with items
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.in: Configure how particles are emitted when using or interacting with items
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.br: Configure how particles should look when brushing blocks with a brush
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Brushing particle mode

§lVanilla-like§r
Uses the vanilla particles when brushing a block. If the block has a Block Particle Override then that will be spawned instead.

§lDust§r
Spawns a dust particle when brushing a block. If the block has a Block Particle Override then that will be spawned instead.

§lDisabled§r
Disables the brushing particles entirely
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.fl: Configure if %s particles are emitted and how many should spawn when you light a block on fire using a flint & steel
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.fi: Configure if %s particles are emitted and how many should spawn when you light a block on fire using a fire charge
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.ax: Configure if %s particles should be spawned when stripping a log with an axe
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.ho: Configure if %s particles should be spawned when tilling a block with a hoe
eg_particle_interactions.config.items.sh: Configure if %s particles should be spawned when flattening a block with a shovel
eg_particle_interactions.config.fluids.d: Configure how particles are emitted when placing fluids
eg_particle_interactions.config.fluids.i: All config options in this tab are applied from top to bottom. This means if a fluid is specified in two separate particle types, it will only emit the particle higher up in the config menu
eg_particle_interactions.config.fluids.g: Fluids that should spawn %s particles when placed
eg_particle_interactions.config.fluids.t:
When should %s particles be emitted?

These particles are tinted with the biome colour of the fluid they are spawned from
Fluids that should spawn %s particles when placed
eg_particle_interactions.config.fluids.g:
When should %s particles be emitted?

These particles are intended for modded fluids that don't fit the options above. It will use the texture of the fluid instead of a splash texture, similar to vanilla block breaking particles
Fluids that should spawn %s particles when placed
eg_particle_interactions.config.global_o: Spawn when fluid placed
Should %s particles spawn when a fluid is placed?
Amount of particles when fluid placed
The amount of particles that spawn inside the fluid when it is placed
